message: The repository will not be public
I'd like one people not to be able to push on master. And I'd like it's code to be reviewed. I believe this is a pull request.
Hi, may I didn't understood something, but I have private repository.

But, as I see it, he must fork the project, but he cannot fork it as a "subproject" but only in his personal account, which will make the repository public (I believe). Therefore for now I given him read/write access to the main repository, asking him not to push inside some branch.
He can fork it to his repository for free and do his work there, submitting pull requests to the main project
@kneath I've been wondering this: what happens to the fork if @yogsototh removes the other person as a contributor?
@catsby the person who is removed loses their fork. Happened to me yesterday.
@dryan That's what I assumed, thanks for confirming
